column4: HELP: Just installed maverick on my laptop. live cd worked fine. but i don't see the desktop after logging in. just the wallpaper is shown. Did apt-get upgrade from terminal (ctrl alt f1). didn't help
think you have to run update first and aptitude is better
I did apt-get upgrade after seeing this problem; din't help
Update just updates the package list. isn't it? I did that prior to upgrade.
how can i solve this 'wallpaper only no desktop after logging in' problem?
I guess the panel fails to load
i saw the panel while running on live cd though?!
I would be inclined to reinstall if that is an option for you
reinstall just the panel? is it possible?
its name is gnome-panel but that may not help
i will try reinstalling that. is it also possible desktop effects are enabled which cause the problem? is there a way to disable it through tty?
at the log on screen you can choose failsafe but its never worked for me
i will try the failsafe as well. thanks for the suggestions.
good news. safe mode works fine!
